title: Quiz 9: Advanced Scenarios & Calculations
description: Complex calculations and clinical scenarios covering burns, fluids, CPR, and ethics.

questions.question: A 50kg patient has 40% burns. Using the Parkland Formula (4ml x % x kg), calculate the TOTAL fluid volume for the first 24 hours (in mls).
In the scenario above (8000mls total), how much fluid should be administered in the FIRST 8 hours?
questions.explanation: Half of the total fluid is given in the first 8 hours. 8000 / 2 = 4000 mls.

questions.question: Scenario: A multiple trauma patient arrives with hypotension. Order the management steps:

items.text: Urgent surgical exploration if >5L fluid fails

questions.explanation: Resuscitate first, check response, then operate if bleeding is uncontrolled.

questions.question: Match the clinical sign to the likely poison:
questions.explanation: Classic toxidromes: CO=Cherry, Opioids=Pinpoint, Arsenic=Garlic, Cyanide=Almonds.

questions.question: Scenario: A patient in ICU has a CVP of 20 cm H2O. What does this indicate?
questions.explanation: Normal CVP is 3-8 cm H2O. 20 is very high, indicating overload.

questions.question: Scenario: Patient has burns to the entire left arm and the front of the trunk. Using Rule of Nines, which areas are involved? (Select percentages)
questions.explanation: Arm is 9%. Front of trunk is 18%. Total 27%.
questions.hint: Check the Rule of Nines diagram mentally.

questions.question: In the 'ICU Treatment Entitlement Index', if the Cost (C) increases, what happens to the Index value?
questions.explanation: Cost is in the denominator. Higher cost = Lower entitlement index.
questions.hint: Math: Dividing by a bigger number.

questions.question: In a case of advanced airway management, the oro-pharyngeal airway is preferred for a semi-conscious patient.
questions.explanation: False. Oro-pharyngeal airway causes gagging in semi-conscious patients; Naso-pharyngeal is preferred.

questions.question: The first step in treating ANY patient with airway obstruction is to ___BLANK___ the airway.
questions.explanation: Open the airway (head tilt/chin lift) before anything else.

questions.question: Scenario: A patient refuses life-saving surgery. The doctor operates anyway. What ethical principle is violated?
questions.explanation: Treating against refusal violates informed consent and patient autonomy.
